response.message: No offense but the references to tumblr.com and huskies was rather strange.  Joel you are losing it...
It was a lot of fun listening in. You might not think it was a good show but it was incredibly entertaining.

Scott Hanselmann is the polite Jim Lehr of software engineering podcasts
StackExchange is the zany morning rush-hour show of software engineering podcasts

This was great, Scott and Joel played well off each other. Definitely entertaining.
100% agree with Scott about the overuse of chat.  Even worse is text messaging via mobile phones.  Discussions are horribly inefficient over this medium.

I loved this podcast, perhaps it wasn't information rich but a group of smart software people being funny (mostly) with bits of info and opinion included  is great.  I was laughing out loud (whilst walking the dog). This is software development project (and practitioner) porn, made me want to give trello another go.
I'm getting weird looks in the cube farm listening to this. I'm laughing so hard I can't see through the tears. Good job folks. Informative and hilarious.

I'm having to learn to stop email / chat and pick up the phone. I don't know why, but sometimes phoning makes me uncomfortable and I have to fight that. It might be because I find the ringing of a phone a bit irritating. It often seems the phone rings when I'm really concentrating on something.
Great fun listening to my first episode of StackExchange. Keep up the great work guys.
I really enjoyed the podcast. I'm glad you guys are making them again.
Had fun listening can't stop control laughing at some point! Very funny and informative!

Hi, 
Nice post and thank you for sharing this post related to StackExchange Podcast.As per my suggestion , this post is really very interesting and innovative to go through for the readers.By going through this post, readers will come across something new and informative facts.



Thank you once again.:)
Somebody has to explain the "a biscuit away" joke to me.  I see the Urban Dictionary definition, but Jerry Stiller doesn't look very chubby to me?
